text: WARNING: Wear eye protection. Inspect the main rotor blade trailing edge for cracks using a flashlight. If crack length exceeds 2.0 mm, replace the blade.
Inspection method: Clean the trailing edge area. Use a flashlight to visually examine the trailing edge from root to tip. Record crack length in millimetres.
Defect criteria: A crack is any linear discontinuity. Measure the crack length along its longest dimension. If multiple cracks exist, evaluate the longest crack.
WARNING: Support the blade before removing the lead-lag damper. Remove the upper bolt using a torque wrench (10-60 Nm) and a 6 mm hex key.
Tightening: Tighten the lead-lag damper upper bolt to 24 Nm. Apply torque gradually and verify the damper moves freely after tightening.
Tools: Flashlight, cleaning cloth, marker pen, ruler (mm scale).
Recording: For each crack, record location (root/mid/tip), length (mm), and whether it intersects the trailing edge.
General safety: Wear eye protection during inspections that involve close visual examination or cleaning solvents.
Service Bulletin: For EC135 T3 S/N 1080-1150, add a secondary inspection using a mirror to view the trailing edge underside.
Procedure steps: (1) Clean area. (2) Illuminate with flashlight. (3) Inspect trailing edge. (4) Measure crack length. (5) Record results.
Note: Minor surface scratches are not cracks. If uncertain, classify as crack and measure length.
Note: If the damper is stiff after tightening, re-check bolt alignment and verify torque.
